page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: Huntly is a town in a rural area in the Gordon Distict,which is in the Grampian Region.In 1981 Huntly's population was estimated at 4360.It was about 1725 when a union of parishes joined up and named the place Huntly.Up till about 1977 or 1978 Huntly was very busy and very noisy , but, then a by_pass was built just around the outside of Huntly and a lot of cars use it to travel to Aberdeen, or in the other direction to Inverness.Huntly has two big schools.A primary and secondary.The primary just provides for Huntly,but the secondary provides for the surrounding villages.In Huntly there are four religions.They are the Episcapalians, the Jehovah's Witnesses, the Roman Catholics and the Presbyterians.All of the religions have their meeting place.
